data.enText: a judgement that you make without having the exact details or figures about the size, amount, cost, etc. of sth

data.chText: 我可以粗略估计一下你所需要的木材量。
data.enText: I can give you a rough estimate of the amount of wood you will need.
a ballpark estimate (= an approximate estimate)

data.chText: 政府对今后十年交通增长的正式估计
data.enText: official government estimates of traffic growth over the next decade

data.chText: 至少5 000人丧生，这还是个保守的估计。
data.enText: At least 5 000 people were killed, and that's a conservative estimate (= the real figure will be higher) .
a statement of how much a piece of work will probably cost
to form an idea of the cost, size, value, etc. of sth, but without calculating it exactly

data.chText: 这颗卫星估计要耗资4亿英镑。
data.enText: The satellite will cost an estimated £400 million.

data.chText: 警方估计聚集的人有3万。
这笔交易估计价值150万元左右。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: The deal is estimated to be worth around $1.5 million.

data.chText: 我们估计要花费大约 5 000 欧元。
data.enText: We estimated (that) it would cost about €5 000.

data.chText: 据估计，这项工程将持续四年。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语 (+ that从句)

data.enText: It is estimated (that) the project will last four years.

data.chText: 很难估计有多少孩子有诵读困难。
data.enText: It is hard to estimate how many children suffer from dyslexia.

simple_means.memory_skill: estim 价值 + ate 表动词 → 估计，估量

ex.chText: 他们决定给这幅画估一估价。
ex.enText: They decided to get the painting valued.

ex.chText: 两个价值超过10万英镑的花瓶从展会上被盗走了。
ex.enText: Two vases valued at over 100,000 were stolen from the exhibition.

synonyms.bx: 指通过与相似之物进行比较而决定某物值多少钱，通常用被动语态。

ex.chText: 他们的公寓估价为30万美元。
ex.enText: The value of their apartment was assessed at $300,000.

ex.chText: 他们花了一周的时间核定赔偿额。
ex.enText: It took them one week to assess the amount of compensation to be paid.

synonyms.bx: 指计算出某事物的价值、数额、质量、重要性等。

ex.chText: 这把椅子估计花了他300元。
ex.enText: This chair is estimated to have cost him 300 yuan.

ex.chText: 组织者估计参加的人有1万。

synonyms.bx: 指估算出某事物的价值、规模、速度等。

tr: a judgment of the qualities of something or somebody
example: many factors are involved in any estimate of human life
in my estimation the boy is innocent

tr: an approximate calculation of quantity or degree or worth
example: an estimate of what it would cost
a rough idea how long it would take

tr: the respect with which a person is held
example: they had a high estimation of his ability

tr: a document appraising the value of something (as for insurance or taxation)
a statement indicating the likely cost of some job
example: he got an estimate from the car repair shop

tr: judge tentatively or form an estimate of (quantities or time)
example: I estimate this chicken to weigh three pounds

value.boxr_value: The verb is pronounced /'estɪmeɪt/. The noun is pronounced /'estɪmət/. 动词读作 /'estɪmeɪt/，名词读作 /'estɪmət/。

value.def: If you estimate a quantity or value, you make an approximate judgment or calculation of it.

example.ex: Try to estimate how many steps it will take to get to a close object...
example.tran: 尽力估算一下达到一个近距离目标需要多少步。

example.ex: I estimate that the total cost for treatment will be $12,500...
example.tran: 我估计治疗费用总共会有12,500美元。

example.ex: He estimated the speed of the winds from the degree of damage...
example.tran: 他根据破坏的程度估算风速。

example.ex: Some analysts estimate its current popularity at around ten per cent...
example.tran: 一些分析家估计它现在的普及率在10%左右。

example.ex: His personal riches were estimated at £68 million.
example.tran: 估计他的个人资产达到6,800万英镑。

example.ex: There are an estimated 90,000 gangsters in the country.

value.def: An estimate is an approximate calculation of a quantity or value.

example.ex: ...the official estimate of the election result...
This figure is five times the original estimate...
example.tran: 这个数据是最初估算的5倍。

example.ex: A recent estimate was that factories were undermanned by about 30 per cent.
example.tran: 最新估算表明工厂的人员不足达30%左右。

gramarinfo.label: usu with supp, oft N <l>of/for</l> n

value.def: An estimate is a judgment about a person or situation which you make based on the available evidence.

example.ex: I hadn't been far wrong in my estimate of his grandson's capabilities.
example.tran: 我对他孙子的能力的判断还不算太离谱。

value.def: An estimate from someone who you employ to do a job for you, such as a builder or a plumber, is a written statement of how much the job is likely to cost.

example.ex: The shop also offers a curtain-making and fitting service. Quotes and estimates can be prepared by computer on the spot.
example.tran: 那家商店还提供窗帘制作和安装服务，而且可以用计算机现场制作报价单和预算书。

trans: 初步估算；初步估计；初步造价预算；概算；初步统计
点估计；点估计值；点推定；点估计式的；点估计法

partsOfSpeech.dec: estim 价值 + able 可…的，能…的；具有…性质的 → 可尊敬的；可估计的
estim 价值 + ate 表动词 → 估计，估量
over 过度 + estimate 估计，估量 → 对…估计过高
under 不足 + estimate 估计，估量 → 低估
